snippet.title: DER SCHATZ IM SILBERSEE (PC DOS) (1993) - Longplay [German] (uncommented)
snippet.description:
DER SCHATZ IM SILBERSEE is a German point-and-click adventure game by Software 2000 released in 1993 for PC MS-DOS. It is very loosely based on the Karl May novel with the same name. As far as I know, the game is only available in German language.

DER SCHATZ IM SILBERSEE was supposed to be the first part of a Karl May inspired game series. However, further titles were never released (the second game DURCH DIE WÜSTE is teasered in the game's outro though).

I find the game's graphics, atmosphere and music very nicely done. However, a number of puzzles are quite frustrating and unnecessarily complicated. Quite frankly, I never really understood what the game wanted me to do or achieve in order to progress - and I don't think I could have finished it without a walkthrough.
